document.docAuthor: Huang, Jia, Li, Tong & Chen, Hongwei
document.masterDocTitle: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The genus Leucophenga (Diptera, Drosophilidae), part IV: the ornata species group from the East Asia, with morphological and molecular evidence (II)

bibRefCitation.author: Duda
bibRefCitation.refString: Duda, O. (1924) Beitrag zur Systematik der Drosophiliden unter besonderer Berucksichtigung der palaarktischen und orientalischen Arten (Dipteren). Archiv Mecklenburgischer Naturforscher, 90 A, 172 - 234.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Leucophenga nigrinervis
Duda, 1924
: 236
;
Li & Wheeler, 1972
: 248
;
Okada, 1990
: 684
.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. Paramere broadened and short (
Fig. 21
C); aedeagus narrowed medially, expanded and with thick pubescence on distal 1 / 3 (
Fig. 21
D).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 21.
Leucophenga nigrinervis
, male terminalia in lateral view. A. epandrium, surstylus and cercus; B. hypandrium, paramere, gonopods, aedeagus and aedeagal apodeme; C. paramere; D. aedeagus. Scale bars = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Description. Ocellar triangle brown, with 2–5 setae above ocellar setae. Frons brownish to brown. Pedicel yellowish brown; first flagellomere yellow. Clypeus dark brown. Palpus brownish yellow. Mesonotum brownish yellow to yellowish brown, sometimes dark brown before scutellum (
Figs 5
J, 6 A). Postpronotal lobe yellow to brownish yellow (
Fig. 6
B). Acrostichal setulae in 12–16 irregular rows (
Figs 5
J, 6 A). Scutellum brownish yellow to brown, black along margin, yellow around apical scutellar setae (
Fig. 5
J), sometimes pale at tip. Pleura with a brown, longitudinal stripe above (
Fig. 6
B). Katepisternum and mesopleuron mostly yellow to brownish yellow; mesopleuron with 1 brownish patch (
Fig. 6
B). Wing (
Fig. 2
D): Costal vein between R 2 + 3 and R 4 + 5 distally with 5–8 peg-like spinules on ventral surface. Mid and hindlegs brown on knees. Abdominal tergites brown to dark brown, with yellow patches (
Fig. 10
E). Male terminalia: Epandrium mostly pubescent, with 10 setae near posterior margin per side (
Fig. 21
A). Paramere round apically, with pubescence and 6 sensilla dorsally (
Fig. 21
C).

Specimens examined. CHINA :
